tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE fashion_partnerships (
  blogger_id INT,
  brand_id INT,
  event_id INT,
  partnership_status VARCHAR(50)
)
CREATE TABLE fashion_bloggers ( blogger_id INT PRIMARY KEY, blogger_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, blogger_email VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE NOT NULL, blogger_followers INT NOT NULL );
CREATE TABLE brands ( brand_id INT PRIMARY KEY, brand_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, brand_category VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, brand_representative VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL );
CREATE TABLE fashion_events ( event_id INT PRIMARY KEY, event_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, event_date DATE NOT NULL, event_location VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL );

CREATE TABLE fashion_bloggers (
    blogger_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    blogger_name VARCHAR(255),
    blogger_email VARCHAR(255),
    follower_count INT
)

CREATE TABLE brands (
    brand_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    brand_name VARCHAR(255),
    brand_category VARCHAR(255),
    country VARCHAR(100)
)

CREATE TABLE fashion_events (
    event_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    event_name VARCHAR(255),
    event_date DATE,
    location VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE partnerships (
    partnership_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    blogger_id UUID REFERENCES fashion_bloggers(blogger_id),
    brand_id UUID REFERENCES brands(brand_id),
    event_id UUID REFERENCES fashion_events(event_id),
    partnership_status VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE blogger_brands (
    blogger_id INT,
    brand_id INT,
    partnership_status VARCHAR(50),
    PRIMARY KEY (blogger_id, brand_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (blogger_id) REFERENCES fashion_bloggers(blogger_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (brand_id) REFERENCES brands(brand_id)
);

CREATE TABLE blogger_events (
    blogger_id INT,
    event_id INT,
    partnership_status VARCHAR(50),
    PRIMARY KEY (blogger_id, event_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (blogger_id) REFERENCES fashion_bloggers(blogger_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (event_id) REFERENCES fashion_events(event_id)
);
